data.title: Corum Group
data.text:
Preation acquires eWeb Designs

Preation, a provider of website services including web design, web development, and web marketing, acquired eWeb Designs. Preation will add more than 100 clients as part of the deal. Over the last five years the eWeb Designs team has built an impressive national client base, helping businesses and organizations of all sizes get a professionally designed website and begin acquiring customers online. As it continues its tenth year of sustained annual growth in excess of 200% Preation has identified a number of high quality firms like eWeb Designs as great opportunities for strategic growth and is actively seeking both strategic partnerships and acquisitions that will allow it to accelerate the influence of its Web Content Management and E-Commerce platforms.

Announcement Date: September 26, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

Internet Association Corporation (IAC) merges with iModules

iModules Software and Internet Association Corporation (IAC) announced that IAC has merged with iModules. iModules Software designs web-based applications for member-based organizations to manage and grow private online communities. As a result, iModules further enhances its position as the worldwide leader in common interest online communities with nearly 600 clients and over 12 million constituents. This transaction allows the companies to combine their efforts and gives IAC clients access to iModules' industry-leading technology.

Announcement Date: September 25, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

EyeWonder acquires vendi interactive

EyeWonder, Inc., interactive digital advertising provider has acquired Germany-based vendi interactive, one of the country's leading digital interactive advertising firms and vendor of online-streaming-spots. The move supports EyeWonder's rapidly growing footprint on Europe's interactive digital advertising industry. The company will provide expanded rich media and other interactive digital offerings in Germany, which will serve as a base for further expansion throughout continental Europe. Over the next 12 months, eMarketer predicts that the European Union's five largest countries will experience 25 percent growth in ad spending and estimates that Internet users will reach the 136 million mark.

Announcement Date: September 25, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

Yahoo! to buy Zimbra

Yahoo! Inc. is acquiring Zimbra Inc., a leader in next generation e-mail and collaboration software. Zimbra's offerings include rich, AJAX-based e-mail, calendar, and contact management features that can be used both on and offline. Their open platform enhances the user experience by enabling creative mash-ups called Zimlets that tie in valuable Web services to e-mail, and can be tailored to fit the needs of every customer. Zimbra will help Yahoo! expand its Yahoo! Mail offerings and will raise the Internet company's presence in universities and businesses by enabling organizations to host e-mail on or off premises with their own domain. Additionally, Zimbra's successful relationships with large ISPs are key, as Yahoo! expands its worldwide partner network. Yahoo! Mail continues to be one of the world's most popular Web mail services with 250 million users worldwide.

Announcement Date: September 17, 2007

Deal Value: $350 million (Cash)

Yahoo! acquires Participate Media (BuzzTracker)

Internet search company Yahoo! has purchased Participate Media which is BuzzTrackers sole product. BuzzTracker tracks 110,000 content sources online, which include blogs and mainstream media and uses an algorithm to sort them by importance, which the site then presents in various topical feeds. Details of how BuzzTracker will be integrated with Yahoo! are still being hammered out but the plan is that BuzzTracker's technology will augment Yahoo! News.

Announcement Date: September 14, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

ForeSee Results acquires Red Spade

ForeSee Results, provider of online customer satisfaction management, has acquired Red Spade, provider of online usability consulting, in order to add a greater degree of actionability to customer satisfaction analysis. Using the proven, scientific methodology of the University of Michigans American Customer Satisfaction Index (ACSI), ForeSee Results quantifies the link between drivers of online satisfaction (such as navigation, product information, functionality, and others) and desirable behaviors like future purchases, return site visits and referrals. Adding usability audit reviews will allow ForeSee Results to provide clients with a direct path to website improvement. Analysis of specific website visitor satisfaction concerns can now be extended to include recommendations on what clients should do to address these issues.

Announcement Date: September 13, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

ChannelAdvisor acquires Marketworks

ChannelAdvisor, provider of e-commerce channel management solutions, has acquired Marketworks, a leader in marketplace management software and services. ChannelAdvisor Corporation provides technology and services that enable leading online retailers to maximize their products across multiple e-commerce marketplaces such as eBay, Amazon.com and Overstock.com, comparison shopping engines such as Shopping.com, Shopzilla, Nextag and Google Product Search, and search engines such as Google, Yahoo! and MSN. In 2006, ChannelAdvisor managed over $1.6 billion in gross merchandise value (GMV) on behalf of its customers.

Announcement Date: September 12, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

Yahoo! is acquiring BlueLithium

Yahoo! Inc. is buying online advertising network BlueLithium, building upon an expansion aimed at ending a financial malaise that has ravaged the Internet pioneer's stock price. Besides operating a large ad network, BlueLithium provides tracking technology, known as "behavioral targeting," that identifies Web surfers with particular interests so the ads they see will be more interesting to them. The deal marks the latest step in Yahoo!'s attempt to regain some of the ground that it has lost during the past three years to Google Inc., whose Internet-leading search engine propels the most lucrative online ad network. Yahoo! recently spent nearly $700 million to buy a major online ad exchange, Right Media Inc., and upgraded its system for distributing ad links tied to search requests. Yahoo! also has extended its reach by agreeing to deliver ads to more partners, including websites of Internet auctioneer eBay Inc., cable provider Comcast Corp. and hundreds of daily newspapers.

Announcement Date: September 4, 2007

Deal Value: $300 million (Cash)

Commerce Planet to acquire Iventa Corporation

Commerce Planet, Inc. is acquiring Iventa Corporation, developer of the Dashboard System, a SaaS e-commerce system utilized by hundreds of customers ranging from SMB to Fortune 500 companies. Iventa maintains a full programming staff via Iventa Software Services located in Mumbai, India. The acquisition of Iventas Dashboard System platform will rapidly accelerate Commerce Planets expansion into the B2B business sector by leveraging Iventas existing customer base which consists of leading companies and brands in many industries including entertainment, publishing and media. In addition, Commerce Planet will be able to immediately offer Iventas software to its customers who are currently using its top producing consumer direct product, Online Supplier.

Announcement Date: September 4, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

Notabene.net A/S to acquire Cubizz Communication

Notabene.net A/S agreed to acquire Cubizz Communication A/S, a Denmark-based provider of online marketing services, from NetInnovation A/S. Concurrently, NO agreed to acquire CrossMedia. CrossMedia provides online marketing services, focusing more on search engine marketing and web traffic measurement.

Announcement Date: September 3, 2007

Deal Value: $6.8 million (combined value of both deals)

Lagardere acquires Nextedia Group

Legardere is acquiring Nextedia, Frances interactive media agency offering a full package of services to advertisers wishing to expand their Internet footprint. Following this acquisition, Lagardère Active will have a team of nearly 300 digital media experts serving over 200 clients as well as proprietary technologies in web-user behavioral analysis, advertising campaign payback analysis, and management of sponsored link auctions. This new deal, following the acquisition of Jumpstart in the United States, demonstrates Lagardère Actives commitment to placing digital at the heart of its strategy. Lagardère is determined to anticipate the consolidation of web publishing, linking and monetization segments.

Announcement Date: August 29, 2007

Deal Value: $67.8 million (Cash plus potential earnout split in 2011 and 2013 up to a maximum of another $67.8, contingent upon the attainment of specified profit targets.)

Amadeus Capital Partners/Northzone Ventures have acquired majority in EPiServer AB

Nordic venture firm NorthZone Ventures has, together with UK investor Amadeus Capital Partners and Swedish investment firm Monterro Holdings, acquired a majority in the Swedish web content management provider EPiServer AB. EPiServer, headquartered in Stockholm, delivers content management and portal solutions through a network of over 200 certified partner companies worldwide. In addition to operations in Sweden, the company has local offices in Norway, India and the UK.

Announcement Date: August 23, 2007

Deal Value: $23.5 million

IBM acquired WebDialogs

IBM (NYSE: IBM) has acquired WebDialogs Inc., provider of web conferencing and communications services with more than 500,000 users worldwide. WebDialogs has raised around $17.5 million in total VC funding since 1998. WebDialogs offers online meeting and collaboration services that combine web and audio conferencing into one, easy-to-use experience. Since it is deployed as a service, WebDialogs technology does not require support from an organization's IT department, making it easy to deploy anytime, anywhere. The WebDialogs service is used by leading audio conferencing providers to extend online meeting capabilities to their users. With the acquisition of WebDialogs, IBM is adding a software-as-a-service delivery model to the Lotus Sametime family of products, providing customers with choice and flexibility in how they buy and operate their web conferencing services. IBM will also integrate the service with its collaboration portfolio, including IBM Lotus Notes and IBM Lotus Sametime software.

Announcement Date: August 21, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

Aplus.Net acquires WebImage

Aplus.Net, a web hosting company and Internet solutions provider, acquired WebImage, a full-service Internet marketing and website development company. With a business model focused on premium Internet presence solutions for small businesses, WebImage is best known for its highly streamlined approach to volume web design. Aplus.Net believes that the remaining 40 percent of small businesses that have yet to establish an Internet presence are unlikely to rely on do-it-yourself web design solutions. Instead, they will demand a complete Internet solution with web design, hosting and marketing services fully integrated into one package. The acquisition of WebImage offers a significant component to its focus on providing a fully integrated Internet presence solution to small businesses.

Announcement Date: August 21, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

PBL/Macquarie Bank to acquire Immobilien Scout GmbH

A Consortium consisting of Publishing and Broadcasting Limited and Macquarie Bank Limited are acquiring 66.2% of Immobilien Scout GmbH. Upon completion, PBL and Macquarie shall each hold an equal interest in the equity of the Consortium, with it being intended that key senior management of Immobilien Scout will be invited to participate as shareholders in the Consortium. Based in Berlin, Immobilien Scout is the leading provider of online classifieds, advertising and business services to the German real estate industry. Immobilien Scouts website contains classified and display advertising from a range of providers including residential agents, property developers and other non-commercial advertisers.

Announcement Date: August 16, 2007

Deal Value: $482 million

Emap PLC acquired Planet Retail Ltd.

Emap Plc (UK) has acquired Planet Retail Limited, an online business information service. Planet Retail is a subscription-based online information service supplying the global retail industry. Planet Retail delivers high value-added retailer and market profiles in the grocery, food service and electronics, entertainment and office sectors. The acquisition fits well with Emap's strong position in the retail and information sectors through strong brands. Emap hopes to accelerate the growth of the business and unlock synergies with its B2B retail portfolio.

Announcement Date: August 16, 2007

Deal Value: $45 million (Cash)

PrecisionIR Group acquires Vodium

PrecisionIR Group, a worldwide provider of web-based communication solutions and online investor relations services, acquired Vodium, a streaming media communications company which specializes in rich media, full-service online events. PrecisionIR currently offers the Vcall brand of webcasting and web event services globally, executing thousands of live web events each quarter. The purchase of Vodium presents opportunities for Vcall to expand their feature range and markets served. The ability to provide new and complementary services across the combined client base is one of the highlights of this acquisition.

Announcement Date: August 16, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

NaviSite acquires Alabanza and Jupiter Hosting

NaviSite, Inc., a provider of application management, Internet infrastructure and hosting solutions for the mid-market, has acquired two privately held providers of hosting services  Alabanza and Jupiter Hosting. Alabanza offers a comprehensive suite of dedicated and shared web hosting services, as well as a highly automated proprietary software platform for provisioning and managing high volume hosting solutions. Jupiter Hosting offers dedicated and complex managed hosting and infrastructure services that include high quality and high bandwidth applications such as IPTV, Video on Demand and Progressive Video Delivery.

Announcement Date: August 13, 2007

Deal Value: $15 million (Cash $6.850 million for Alabanza $8.698 million for Jupiter Hosting)

Datavantage/CommercialWare acquires eOne Group

Datavantage/CommercialWare, a leading provider of retail technology for the specialty and general merchandise retail industry, acquires a majority interest in eOne Group, an e-commerce solutions provider. eOne Group and its offerings will be integrated into Datavantage/CommercialWare (which will be renamed MICROS-Retail later this year). Datavantage/CommercialWare provides its customers a comprehensive suite of retail solutions, including point-of-sale, order management, customer service, inventory and fulfillment systems, business analytics, loss prevention and marketing applications that allow merchants to efficiently deliver on the customer experience transparently across channels. The addition of eOne Group extends the capabilities to offer full support for the front end, customer facing transactional websites and allows retailers to embrace Web 2.0 and the growth of this channel.

Announcement Date: August 13, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

Triton Pacific Capital Partners acquires Vayan Marketing Group, LLC

Triton Pacific Capital Partners, LLC, a private equity firm focused on investing in small to medium sized entrepreneurial technology, healthcare and business services companies, has acquired Vayan Marketing Group, LLC. Vayan is a leading provider of online lead generation, email marketing, offline marketing, list management and affiliate marketing services. Vayan Marketing Group will form the core of TPCs Internet media and marketing services investment strategy and is the third technology company in the PE firms portfolio.

Announcement Date: August 13, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

Hearst Corp. acquires Kaboodle

Hearst has agreed to acquire Kaboodle Inc., an online social shopping community. Its another surprise acquisition of a forgotten startup by an old-school media company. Like many bookmarking sites, Kaboodle was founded in 2005 as a place to save images and links and began to focus on social shopping and peer recommendations. Hearst wants to build pages within Kaboodle featuring products from womens magazines like Cosmopolitan and Good Housekeeping, and also build the site into more of a lifestyle portal.

Announcement Date: August 8, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed (Though rumors are of a $40 million exit)

NDS acquires CastUp Inc.

NDS Group Plc, (London) a leading provider of technology solutions for digital pay-TV, acquired CastUp Inc, a leader in solutions for management and delivery of video over the Internet. CastUp Inc., through its wholly owned subsidiary in Israel, provides a robust end-to-end solution for acquisition, processing, distributing, serving and monetizing of rich media content over IP and, in particular, video and audio over the Internet. This acquisition affords NDS access to technologies which will help its current pay-TV customers expand their broadband video distribution services as well as attracting new potential customers. CastUps proven rich media technology will also help NDS to develop new enhanced services and applications for broadband-enabled set-top boxes (hybrid STBs).

Announcement Date: August 7, 2007

Deal Value: $11.3 million (Cash plus undisclosed additional payments to senior management)

Packetfront Inc. acquires DynamicCity

PacketFront, a pioneer of open access broadband networking, acquired DynamicCity, the operational force behind the groundbreaking UTOPIA initiative. This acquisition is about taking the best thinking in North America on open access broadband and public broadband initiatives and combining it under one roof. With the addition of the DynamicCity team Packetfront can now offer the local experience, knowledge and capacity its clients need to design, finance, build, manage and market large-scale, successful open access networks.

Announcement Date: August 7, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

iCrossing acquires Proxicom

Gores Group has sold web development agency Proxicom Inc. to iCrossing Inc., a Scottsdale, Ariz.-based digital marketing company. No financial terms were disclosed. iCrossing has raised around $141 million in total VC funding, from firms like Goldman Sachs, Oak Investment Partners, RRE Ventures and StarVest Partners.

Announcement Date: July 30, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

Microsoft to acquire AdEC Web Ad Exchange

Microsoft announced an acquisition designed to round out its online advertising business. The software maker agreed to buy AdECN Inc., an exchange similar to the stock market where networks representing websites buy and sell ad space. AdECN's technology serves as a hub where advertising networks can come together in a neutral, real-time auction marketplace for buying and selling display advertising. With the pending acquisition of aQuantive Inc., Microsoft will inherit the ability to sell ads across a network of websites. Owning AdECN will help Microsoft sell unwanted ad space on aQuantive network sites and its own properties, and may also increase what Microsoft can charge for in-demand ad slots. Yahoo! Inc. recently bought another ad exchange, Right Media Inc., for nearly $700 million. Microsoft is taking aim at what it predicts will be an $80 billion market by 2010, but the company still lags far behind Google Inc. and Yahoo!, which lead the field in search traffic and related advertising revenue.

Announcement Date: July 26, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

Facebook acquires Parakey

Facebook Inc., the owner of the Internet's second most popular social networking site, bought Parakey, a startup run by co-founders of Mozilla Firefox, the open-source and non-profit web browser which has been downloaded more than 300 million times by people worldwide. Parakey was founded to build a platform bridging the gap between information on the web and the desktop. The work they've done with Firefox and Parakey and their approach to building products fit right in at Facebook. The deal represents the first acquisition in Facebook's three-year history.

Announcement Date: July 19, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

ValueClick to buy MeziMedia

ValueClick is acquiring MeziMedia Inc., which operates comparison shopping websites. MeziMedia ranked fourth in the June 2007 comScore "Retail  Comparison Shopping" category with approximately 10.5 million U.S. unique visitors through its Smarter.com comparison shopping and CouponMountain.com online coupon websites. ValueClick said the acquisition, which is expected to add to earnings per share, will help boost its presence in the U.S. comparison shopping market. ValueClick already offers comparison shopping in Europe under the PriceRunner brand.

Announcement Date: July 16, 2007

Deal Value: $100 million (Cash at closing plus potential to $352 million, depending on performance thresholds)

Seller Revenue: $40 million (2006)

Landmark Communications acquires Digital Envoy

Landmark Communications, Inc., a privately held diversified media company, acquired Digital Envoy, Inc., the pioneer of Internet Protocol (IP) Intelligence and Geolocation technology. Digital Envoy is the parent company of Digital Element, the leading provider of IP Intelligence for a variety of media and Internet applications, and Digital Resolve, a leading provider of online fraud and identity theft prevention solutions. The acquisition continues Landmark's strategy of acquiring leading providers of Internet services and online marketing solutions with excellent growth opportunities.

Announcement Date: July 12, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

Level 3 Communications has acquired Servecast

Level 3 Communications, Inc. has acquired Servecast Limited, an Ireland-based provider of live and on-demand video management and streaming services for broadband and mobile platforms. Servecast offers proven publishing and distribution tools for video rights holders to monetize their digital assets. These tools enable customers to manage, protect, deliver and track online audio and video content. Servecasts video and rights management platform, combined with its streaming services complement Level 3s existing portfolio of content delivery capabilities. The addition of these services accelerates Level 3s planned development of this technology. These capabilities will enable Level 3 to manage and distribute online video content in multiple formats to meet the increasing demand for high-quality video over the Internet.

Announcement Date: July 11, 2007

Deal Value: $45 million (Cash)

FAST acquires AgentArts

Fast Search & Transfer (Norway), a global provider of search technologies acquired AgentArts, Inc., a leading personalization and recommendation technology company. AgentArts' patented technology translates various types of user activity into meaningful content relationships which then power a wide variety of recommendation features. By adding personalization and recommendation capabilities to the FAST product line, including the market-leading FAST enterprise search platform, FAST becomes the first major search vendor to offer these features as part of a fully integrated platform. This ensures that FAST customers in the mobile, media, entertainment, ecommerce and knowledge discovery markets can quickly capitalize on the most innovative and effective methods to communicate with their users.

Announcement Date: July 10, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

Notabene.net to acquire Guava

Notabene.net (Denmark), one of the largest online marketing companies in Scandinavia, has acquired UK-based Guava Ltd. Guava is one of the largest and most well-respected search engine marketing and web development companies in the UK. In a market with giants like Google, Yahoo! and Microsoft dominating the headlines of online marketing globally, Danish Notabene.net A/S is about to create a strong niche for its own Search Engine Marketing business. It is Notabene.net's intention to become Northern Europe's leading player in the field of online marketing, an objective that Notabene.net has planned to achieve through acquisitions, internal growth, highly-qualified employees and technological developments.

Announcement Date: July 6, 2007

Deal Value: Undisclosed

NetBooster SA acquires Total Management Oy

NetBooster SA of France acquired the entire share capital of Total Management Oy (Finland), a provider of Internet search engine services.

Announcement Date: July 4, 2007

Deal Value: $7.8 million (Cash)

Google buys GrandCentral Communications

Google Inc. purchased web-based phone service GrandCentral Communications. GrandCentral's services let users personalize phone usage with web-based features like the ability to assign a single phone number that rings various phones at once, records calls and accesses visual voicemail. Grand Central is one of dozens of innovative companies that are taking advantage of web-based software to allow consumers and businesses to make voice calls over the Internet while also working with regular phones. GrandCentral's technology fits well into Google's efforts to provide services that enhance the collaborative exchange of information between our users.

Announcement Date: July 2, 2007
